BP9DL90.transcript_text1:
Thank you. Good morning to all the participants in this webcast conference call regarding Inditex results for the interim 3 months of 2014. I am Pablo Isla. And here with me today are Ignacio Fernández, our CFO; and Marcos López, Capital Markets Director.
The results for the first quarter 2014 show that Inditex continues its global multi-concept, multi-channel growth. Inditex operating performance in the quarter has been strong. The store and online sales in local currencies have grown 11%. Our operations have also shown high efficiency and tight operating control over the period. Let me also tell you that in terms of expansion, our space growth and online launches for the year are on track. We have opened stores in 26 different markets over the period, demonstrating the global reach of Inditex business model. We have continued our global online rollout during the quarter. 
The next steps will be the launch of online sales in South Korea and Mexico in September. We also plan to open Zara in Tmall in China over the Autumn-Winter season. We continue to see significant growth opportunities for Inditex globally. 
Let me now hand over to Ignacio, who will provide you some -- with some detail behind the headline numbers. And I will join you later for the outlook section.

---

Thank you. In the first quarter 2014, Inditex achieved net sales of EUR 3.7 billion, EBITDA of EUR 732 million and net income of EUR 406 million. Inditex has had a strong operating performance. As you have seen in our financial release, currency translation due to the strong yield of business, several currencies has been the future of the period. 
Tempe is a supplier of shoes and accessories for Inditex, in which Inditex has a 50% interest. According to the new IASB rule, it is mandatory to consolidate its 50% interest in Tempe according to the equity method. This interest was previously consolidated on a proportional basis. It is just a presentation issue on the profit and loss account with no impact on net income.
Starting with sales. I want to tell you that Inditex sales performance in the quarter has been satisfactory. Store and online sales in local currencies have grown 11%. Reported sales have grown 4%. Evolution of currencies against the euro has deducted 6 percentage points from this line. Additionally, the change in the consolidation method of Tempe has deducted around 1% from reported sales. 
In line with our comments at the time of our fiscal 2015 results, we expect the impact of currency translation to diminish markedly over 2014, so the currencies remain at current levels. Gross profit has increased 3% to EUR 2.2 billion, resulting in a 58.9% gross margin on sales. We have sustained our commercial policies over the period. 
Operating expenses are tightly under control. They have grown 6%, facilitating mainly the growth in the space, and include all the start-up costs from new openings. Operating working capital remains negative as a consequence of the business model. The working capital evolution is in line with the performance over the period. 
I will now hand over to Marcos, who will elaborate on the performance of the Inditex concepts.

---

In terms of space addition and online launches, we are on track. Continuing with our global expansion, we have opened stores in 26 markets over the period. Regarding the performance by concept, in the first quarter of 2014, Zara and the younger concepts group, together, have performed broadly in line with each other with some minor differences. Regarding the younger concepts, Oysho, Uterqüe, Massimo Dutti and Zara Home have performed above the average, and Bershka below the average. 
I will now hand over to Pablo for the outlook section.

---

Thank you, Marcos. With respect to expansion in 2014, let me highlight that space growth and online launches are on track. Regarding the outlook for the first half of 2014, I would like to add that the store sales in local currencies from the 1st of February to the 8th of June have grown by 11%. Inditex Board of Directors has proposed a 5-for-1 stock split to the general shareholders meeting to be held on 15th, July. If approved, each Inditex shareholder on record at the close of business on 25th, July will receive 5 new shares for every existing share held on the record date. Trading of the new shares will begin on 28th, July. For the rest of 2014, we will continue to invest, profitably expanding our business in a number of markets with attractive long-term returns through our multi-concept and multi-channel strategy. 
Inditex is present on 5 continents and in all the key markets, demonstrating the group's global reach. We manage a diversified sales platform in 88 markets. The current base offers huge growth potential for the coming years. Inditex enjoys a fully-integrated, globally-scalable online operation, which fits perfectly into our business model. This has allowed a rapid growth of our online presence in conjunction with our retail expansion. We have established online sales in Europe, the United States, China, the Russian Federation, Japan and Canada, the world's main economies. We will continue rolling out online sales in selected markets to enhance our global presence. To this end, Zara will launch online sales in South Korea and Mexico in September. We also plan to open Zara in Tmall in China over the Autumn-Winter season. 
Our online operations take advantage of the central inventory position of our business model and employ online stockroom -- stockrooms to enhance last mile distribution. Following a strong online sales growth, we have opened our third European online stockroom in Poland in May to service Central Europe. We have also opened our second online stockroom in the United States, in Los Angeles to service the strong demand on the West Coast. 
Before closing, I would like to cover a number of initiatives carried out by Inditex concepts and some selected store openings. Pull&Bear has opened a flagship store of 700 square meters at Milan's Corso Vittorio Emanuele. Massimo Dutti has recently launched a new store image that can be seen in its flagship at El Borne in Mallorca. Bershka has launched a new store image to be rolled out in all its new stores. Stradivarius has launched in Japan with a number of stores, including Tokyo Bay. Oysho has developed a new yoga collection and sponsors -- sponsored free yoga sessions in Milan, Madrid and Barcelona. Zara Home continues its expansion in Japan with a flagship store at Aoyama in Tokyo. Uterqüe has launched a new store image that is now being rolled out in all new openings. 
Zara Serrano in Madrid is a flagship of 3,700 square meters with a new store image and very powerful architectural features. Zara has opened a flagship at Bahnhofstrasse in Zürich last Friday. This is one of the most relevant stores in Switzerland. Zara will open a global flagship at Queen's Road in Hong Kong in the coming days. This will be one of the most prominent stores in Asia. Zara is opening a flagship store at Miami's Lincoln Road today. This is one of our most high-profile stores in the United States. Zara has opened a flagship store at Figueroa in Downtown Los Angeles last Thursday. Zara has also opened at Seattle's Westlake Center with a very strong reception. We have opened a store in South Africa at Cresta Shopping Centre in Johannesburg. 
And finally, we would like to close this presentation with the Zara store opening at Chadswood in Sydney. And this is all from us. We will be pleased to answer any questions you may have.

If approved, each Inditex shareholder on record at the close of business on 25th, July will receive 5 new shares for every existing share held on the record date. Trading of the new shares will begin on 28th, July. Zara Home continues its expansion in Japan with a flagship store at Aoyama in Tokyo. Uterqüe has launched a new store image that is now being rolled out in all new openings. 
Zara Serrano in Madrid is a flagship of 3,700 square meters with a new store image and very powerful architectural features. Zara has opened a flagship at Bahnhofstrasse in Zürich last Friday. This is one of the most relevant stores in Switzerland. Zara will open a global flagship at Queen's Road in Hong Kong in the coming days. This will be one of the most prominent stores in Asia. Zara is opening a flagship store at Miami's Lincoln Road today. This is one of our most high-profile stores in the United States. Zara has opened a flagship store at Figueroa in Downtown Los Angeles last Thursday. Zara has also opened at Seattle's Westlake Center with a very strong reception. We have opened a store in South Africa at Cresta Shopping Centre in Johannesburg.
